    About me

    I'm Thi, a Vietnamese Data Scientist who has a curious mind. As an never-stop-learning worm, I am interested in researching and sharing contents about applied maths and data science. I have a Ph.D. degree in Applied Maths at U. Sorbonne Paris Nord, France and a very enthusiastic self-learner in Data Science.

    I use this website to document everything I learned while going through the process of learning and working in this field.

    • From Vietnam
    • Age 30
    • Location Île-de-France, France
    • Github github.com/dinhanhthi
    • LinkedIn linkedin.com/in/dinhanhthi
    • Email dinhanhthi@gmail.com
    • Available for a full-time job!

    Experiences

    Dataswati
    1/2020 — 11/2020

    Data Scientist

    Dataswati, 1/2020 — 11/2020

    I am one of the main maintainers of POPAI, Dataswati's main AI library. I work on 4 main projects/clients with different subjects in Machine Learning and Data Science.

    Math2IT
    2013 — current

    Founder & Web Dev & Blogger

    Math2IT, 2013 — current

    Math2IT is a Vietnamese community on mathematics, education and technology. I writes about mathematics and technology in an intuitive way. I'm also the admin of a community on mathematics and technology on Facebook.

    U. Sorbonne Paris Nord
    2013 — 2018

    Researcher in Applied Maths & Coder

    U. Sorbonne Paris Nord, 2013 — 2018

    I researched on the growth of biofilm by using Finite Element Method, a numerical analysis method. Thesis's title is "Finite Element Methods for nonlinear interface problems. Application to a bioﬁlm growth model". For the implementation, I used FreeFem++ and self-built NXFEM toolbox.

    U. Sorbonne Paris Nord
    2013 — 2018

    Doctor in Applied Maths

    U. Sorbonne Paris Nord, 2013 — 2018

    I researched on the growth of biofilm by using Finite Element Method, a numerical analysis method. Thesis's title is "Finite Element Methods for nonlinear interface problems. Application to a bioﬁlm growth model". For the implementation, I used FreeFem++ and self-built NXFEM toolbox.
